item.title: Log-Sum-Exp trick for getting posterior probabilities from small likelihoods.
item.description: To formulate the problem, consider calculating the posterior probability given a series of weighted likelihoods. Let $$ x_i $$ be the likelihood for observation i. We wish to calculate the posterior probability as: $$ p_i = \frac{x_i}{\sum_j x_j} $$ As Robert Eisele very nicely discusses in his blog post, we can run into underflow issues. Suppose you have the following vector of logged likelihoods. x <- c(-9000, -3000, -1000) exp(x)/sum(exp(x)) # [1] NaN NaN NaN As we can see, all the values will be zero.
